Word: achchānā "to be cut (of one's foot on a stump, or one's hand with a penknife)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Traskānā, Gondi_Muask-to cut (meat), carve (ask-is pl. action ofacc-)

Notes: The form*māy-means 'my mother', while*mīy-is 'your mother'

Word: ōr/ōl (obl. ōn-), pl. ōṛ/ōṛk "he, that man, those men"

Notes: In some dialects only encountered with the pronominal prefixt-.
Koyayeŋgeshould be considered as a 1st person possessive form ('my..')

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trmaipōmy father;mī-āpōthy father; Gondi_Ko (Su.)tappe(his, her) father

Notes: Retroflex articulation in Betul and Mandla is strange and probably erroneous. Various epenthetic vowels in different dialects are due to developments*arjil>*arijl>*arijVl, on one side, and*arjil>*arVjil>*arVjl>*arVjVl, on the other.

Additional forms: Also caus. Gondi_Trarhuttānā, Gondi_Pharahtānā,arsahtānā, Gondi_Muarih-/arh-, Gondi_Sarah-, Gondi_A (SR)arusānāto cause to fall; Gondi_Korāl-to fall (< Telugu)

Word: awwal (pl. awwāhk) "mother, dam of man or beast"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Maavval(pl.avvasku) mother; Gondi_Lavālmother; Gondi_Trmaiwalmy mother (lit. our mother);mīwalthy mother (lit. your mother);awhāṛīmother, dam of man or beast; Gondi_Phavhā̆rīid. (for-harisee 2357)

Word: ārānā "to warm oneself, to grow cool"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Ph caus.ārsahtānā; Gondi_Mu caus.ārih-; Gondi_S caus.ārcah-

Word: aiānā "(irregular: 3 sg. impf.ānd-; some forms from stemā-) to be"

Notes: In most dialects*berāl->*berel-through assimilation.

Word: purkā "the gourd of which Pardhāns make their guitar"
sāhatānā (sāhc-) "to stretch out (one's hands or feet as women do when fighting)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tr, Gondi_A (SR)sāngānāto spread as a creeper; Gondi_Ma caus.āʔ-; Gondi_Koāh-to stretch out
Notes: The Adilabad form shows an irregular c-; Telugu influence?

Word: hilkānā "to be caught up, entangled, or stuck in anything"
Notes: Burrow & Emeneau put this root together with*jiRk-, but this is impossible. Not only the resonant is different, but alsoh-in Gondi_A and Gondi_Tr hardly can be traced back to*j-. More probable is the reconstruction*c-or*s-with a usual mix-up before*-l-.

Word: sinder "a splinter of wood, bamboo, etc."

Notes: Gondi_Mu is irregular (*hīkaṛwould be expected), probably re-borrowed from another dialect.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trsohalē-jāṭāthe kōnch or cow-itch, Mucuna pruriens; Gondi_A (Su.)coh-,cohk-to itch

Word: sū̆rwe-phukī "bee which builds in hollow boughs"
Notes: Gondi_Maur̨ve tallahasu-probably due to specific accent/reduction reasons.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Chd caus.huṛsutānāto show; Gondi_Whūṛsahtānāto reveal; Gondi_Ph, Gondi_Wsūrālblind
Notes: The formhupsānāis probably borrowed from Telugu.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tr caus.rehtānā,ragstānāto cause to descend
Also Gondi_Wāwsahtānāto dispatch; Gondi_Muavh-/avih-to make to reach, bring, obtain

Notes: External data makes us regard-umhere as part of the root.

Word: ērānā "to be separated, be separate from"

Notes: The formēt-goes back to*ēn-t-; however, Gondi_Lerpānāis probably not related.

Word: gingōn_-gongōn_ aiānā "to be crooked, as a snake's progress"
gummur maṛā "the kumīn tree, Careya arborea"
gubīā "dense tangle of tall grass and thorn at the foot of a thorny bush"
ēl (obl. ēn-), pl. ēṛ "he, this man, these men"
Notes: The original quality of the vowel has been preserved in Gondi_S (īn<*iv-n) and Gondi_Ch, which alone of all dialects has preserved some traces of-v-in its former position:iyel<*iv-l<*iv-nR. In most other dialects vowel quality has been modified, and some preserved the original-v-by means of a metathese.

Additional forms: Most dialects haveranḍ; Also Gondi_Tr, Gondi_Phrahk rahktwo each; Gondi_W, Gondi_Chranṭeboth, pair; Gondi_Trrancētwo or so

Notes: Forms with-kare actually plural forms.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tr, Gondi_Ph, Gondi_Chd fem.raiyā; Gondi_L fem.leyā; Gondi_Ma fem.leya(pl.-sk); Gondi_Ko fem.lēydaṛ, (T)ledāḍi;Gondi_A (Su.) fem.ḍiyyā; Gondi_A (SR)lehmīyouth
Also Gondi_Tryeh-gatāthe water gnat;yeha-kkorrthe diving grebe; Gondi_W, Gondi_Phetkthirst
Notes: The form 'thirst' should be reconstructed as*etk.
The exact ending of the word in PG is unclear.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Yēṛvir, Gondi_Mandērur, Gondi_Sēṛur, Gondi_Maēṛvurseven (masc.); Gondi_Tryēṛkseven each

Word: gandhēl "the large yellow house hornet (< IA)"
Notes: In Gondi_Mukaraṭiwe see the original-r-that has fallen out everywhere else in the cluster*-rnḍ-; this also led to vowel lengthening.
Gondi_Trkaṛāis irregular (*-l-would be expected). Maybe it doesn't belong here.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_A (SR)karivāla student;karusānāto teach; Gondi_Chdkarutānā, Gondi_Trkarehtānā, Gondi_Wkarahtānā, Gondi_Phkarrahtānā, Gondi_Mukarih-, Gondi_Makar̨ʔ-to teach

Word: kanckānā "to dream, cry out in one's sleep"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trkanskstānāto send a dream (of god); Gondi_A (SR)kanjkānāto dream
Also Gondi_Phkarsahtānā, Gondi_Mukaṛih-to burn (tr.); Gondi_Mukaṛhafield for burning cultivation; Grigsonkarearea set apart for penda cultivation when left fallow for a term

Word: karrē "the long thin pole of a carrying yoke"
kaiṭṭānā, (Gramm. kaittānā) "to taste bitter, as quinine"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_W, Gondi_Phkaitālbitter; Gondi_Trkehkebitter; Gondi_Mukaylebitter;kaymul burkabitter gourd; Gondi_Kokaymulbitter; Gondi_Lkayārraw, unripe; Gondi_Kokay-kaṭbile; Gondi_A (Su.)kaymūlbitterness

Word: kaṛēngānā "to be swung or shaken, as a coat on a peg"
kēpānā "to watch, guard, take care of"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Ko (Su.)kāp-to boil; Gondi_Mkāstahot; Gondi_Trkāsuhtānā, Gondi_Wkāsahtānā, Gondi_A (SR)kāsusānāto heat
Also Gondi_Mukism-to pinch; Gondi_Trkiccānāto pick bhājī, i.e. green leaves for salad

Word: koḍḍī "tender tip or shoot of a plant or tree"
kōkōcī "large wooden fork or hook used for hanging ploughs on"
koīānā, kōīyānā "to gather berries, mangoes, etc., harvest wheat or crops"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Akoṭelamallet; Gondi_Mu, Gondi_Makoṭeladrumstick; Gondi_Mukohk-to gore; Gondi_A (Su.)kohk-to grind into a paste, pound (in a mortar), beat stalks of millet, wheat, etc. on the ground so that the seeds fall down

Word: kōr (obl. kōt-, pl. kōhk) "horn of cattle or wild animals, branch of a tree"
kōṛsānā, kōrsānā "to sprout, grow (of trees, plants, etc.)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Mukoṛk-ilanew leaf; Gondi_Makoṛtamonth of Bhadrā (Aug.-Sept.) when new paddy is worshipped; Gondi_A (Su.)koṛkēlātender, young
Notes: Original vowel length preserved in Gondi_Trkōṛs-.

Word: kurrumne aiānā "to dry up completely, of crops"
surunḍānā "to go round and round, esp. in the Bhawar marriage ceremony"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Wmargīnāto err;marangtālastray; Gondi_Mmārānāto lose; Gondi_A (Su.)marūm-to forget; Gondi_Trmakkānāto escape notice; Gondi_Wmakkānāto hide (intr.); Gondi_Trmakstānā,maksuhtānā, Gondi_Wmaksahtānā(tr.); Gondi_M

Word: mai-mansāl "man and wife, male and female"
wanjī "rice, both growing and in the grain"
maṛsānā "to visit frequently, come again and again (as pigs to a field)"

Additional forms: Most dialects havemara; also Gondi_Mumaṛa naya kind of animal living on trees; Gondi_Komāṛ nēywild dog

Word: marḍ maṛā "the sāj tree, Terminalia tomentosa"
mēīānā "to graze (of cattle and of ground-feeding birds)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trmehtānāto graze cattle;mehtārīgrazier, herd; Gondi_Mmehānāto graze; Gondi_A, Gondi_Y, Gondi_Dmēh-, Gondi_Mu, Gondi_Smeh-, Gondi_Mamēʔ-to grze (tr.)
Also Gondi_Amiṛc-to lighten; Gondi_A (Su.)miṛc-to glitter;miṛcvallightning; Gondi_Lu_Smeersheetattalightning; Gondi_Mamiṛŋgor̨spark; Gondi_A (Su.)minŋūṛspark

Word: mihītānā "to wash somebody else's body, esp. infants"
muccānā "to wrap something round one's body, put new skins on a drum"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trmuccī, Gondi_Ph, Gondi_Mumuccea lid or cover; Gondi_Mamuccecover of pot, lid

Word: mus mus kowwānā "to smile or half-laugh"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trmuṛhuttānāto plunge (tr.); Gondi_Wmuriānā(sun) to set; Gondi_Ph caus.murīsahtānā,murahtānā; Gondi_Mmuṛndānāto sink, be drowned; Gondi_Ko (Su.)mu-to immerse (tr.); Gondi_A (Su.)muḍḍūŋ-to be immersed;muḍḍūs-to immerse
Also Gondi_Munaḍum narkamidnight; Gondi_Konaḍ narkamidnight; Gondi_Mnaṛimursūlwaist;mursulnaṛīloins; Gondi_A (Su.)naṭpēmiddle (adj.);naḍḍīwaist;naḍḍūmcentre, middle
Also Gondi_Mrac nāī, Gondi_Korasi neywild dog
Also Gondi_Trnālkfour each; Gondi_Y, Gondi_Mu, Gondi_Ma, Gondi_Snāluŋ, Gondi_A (SR)nālung, Gondi_W, Gondi_Lnālūng, Gondi_Chdnalung, Gondi_Mndlālũfour (non-masc.)
Also caus. Gondi_Tr, Gondi_W, Gondi_Phnāhtānā, Gondi_Trnāndstānā, Gondi_A (SR)nāhānāto wet, soak; Gondi_Y, Gondi_G, Gondi_Mu, Gondi_Ma (S), Gondi_Snāh-, Gondi_MAnāʔ-, Gondi_Konā/h/-to make wet
Also Gondi_Snōṭ-to twine (rope); Gondi_A (Su.)nōṛerope, bowstring;nōṭ-to entwine
Also Gondi_Chnattur raŋred; Gondi_Munatralblackish red; Gondi_Hislopnetralred

Notes: The syncopation here is similar to the process in*nelenǯ"moon" q.v.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_FHneṭalfrom today; Gondi_Konēṭkefor today; Gondi_Trnēṭia day (only as a suffix); Gondi_Phitwār-nēṭSunday

Word: ēmānā "to sift out husks of rice, pulse, etc."

Additional forms: Also caus. Gondi_Trnilehtānāto make to stand, set up (a tent); Gondi_Wnilahtānā, Gondi_Phniccahtānā, Gondi_Munitih-, Gondi_Snipcah-, Gondi_Konilsp-to make to stand

Word: nindānā "to be filled (of pots, of a bazaar or assembly)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tr, Gondi_W, Gondi_Phnihtānā, Gondi_A, Gondi_G, Gondi_Mu, Gondi_S, Gondi_Konih-, Gondi_Maniʔ-to fill (tr.)

Word: rōskānā "to bail out, bail out a pool in order to catch fish"

Notes: Most dialects havenūŋg
Also Hislopnur, Gondi_A (Su.)nūr(pl.nuhk) hundred

Word: wadītānā "to twist or twirl fibre into a thread"

Additional forms: Also Gondi (many dial.)undione; Gondi_Luncāone or other
Also Gondi_Yoronealone; Gondi_Pharpā āyānāto assemble; Gondi_Trwārsanēall at once or together
Notes: The formwōṛulcan only be traced back to a form with*ō-, although the reasons of such a lenghtening are unclear. Initial*w-is strange too (maybe it is due to some specific sandhi). Inwārsanēoriginal*ōis assimilated to following-a-.

Word: wōṛānā "to burst of an egg or pot"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trwōhtānāto burst (tr.), (chicks) hatch out; Gondi_Aōh-to break (tr.)

Word: paiyānā "to be split (of wood, with axe)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Mupayih-/pah-,Gondi_Wpaiyatānā,paihatānā, Gondi_Phpaiyahtānā,paisahtānā, Gondi_Kopah-to split (tr.); Gondi_Trpakkī, Gondi_W, Gondi_Phpahkī, Gondi_Mupaki, Gondi_Kopaksplit bamboo
Also Gondi_Mupaŋ, in:paŋ vīnahkthe whole night

Word: paṭṭānā "to sit, crouch (of men or animals), (buffaloes) to wallow"
parrānā "to pick up from the ground, gather (mahuas)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_A (SR)perrānāto gather; Gondi_Trpehkānāto pick up; Gondi_Wpahkānāto glean, Gondi_Phpahkānāto choose; Gondi_Mpehkānāto lift, pick; Gondi_S, Gondi_Kopehk-, Gondi_Mapeʔk-to pick up

Also Gondi_Kopermapriest; Gondi_FHpersa pēnhighest god of the Gonds; Gondi_Kopeddalheadman of village; (Su.)pedeyālfather's elder brother; Gondi_Kopers-to grow, grow up; caus.persp-; Gondi_Abers-, Gondi_Mubars-to grow; Gondi_Mpersānāto extend

Word: panēkā "bone, hard seed inside a fruit"

Meaning: to strain at stool, exert oneself violently in vain (as in lifting a burden)

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trpūrāl-kāṭāa kind of thin, poor grass

Notes: Short vowel in some Gondi dial. maybe by analogy with the deriv. *pīt-k- > pih-k- in some dial.; on the other hand, cf. Tel.pittu.

Word: puṭṭānā "to be born, occur, be found, be met with"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trpuṛītānā, Gondi_Mupuṛ-to breed worms; Gondi_Chpuṛi-to be worm-eaten

Meaning: to be rotten, go bad (food, eggs)

Word: sarrānā "to be split as wood, be torn (of clothes, shoes, paper, etc.)"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Ysīyuŋ, Gondi_Muhayuŋ,hayŋ, Gondi_Maayŋfive (non-masc.); Gondi_Trsaik saik, Gondi_Muhayk-haykṭanfive each
Also Gondi_Tr caus.hanstānāto cause to be lost or wasted
Notes: Gondi_Mahan-is unclear, since it is almost the only case of initialh-there; probably influenced by neighbouring dialects.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trsanne-mīārsister's daughter;sannē-marrīsister's son;sēlār-sannēyounger sister's husband; Gondi_A (SR)saṇeyounger sister's husband; Gondi_A (ASu.)saṛēson-in-law
Also Gondi_Trsārksix each; Gondi_W, Gondi_Phsarne(W) fourth day after tomorrow, (Ph) sixth day
Notes: In Gondi_Gs-preserved by analogy with 'five'.

Word: sēṛānā "to invade a country, enter or occupy a house"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_W, Gondi_Phcirnīcomb for removing nits
Notes: The word for 'comb' is probably borrowed from SDR.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trsoiyal korrfowl with feathers which stand on end
Also Gondi_Trtallā(pl.tallāng) the part of the comb in which honey is stored; Gondi_Matallahoneycomb

Notes: Koyatammāl<*tammuR-āl.

Word: taggānā "to wear well (of clothes), remain in one's service (of servants)"
tarmī "a glowing piece of wood ash"
tehcānā "to sift in a sūpā with a tossing motion, not sidewise"

Additional forms: Many dialects have:ṭanḍ-,ṭenḍ-,tenḍ-to take out, take off, remove

Word: tehtānā "to cause to rise, build a house"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_A (Su.)teh-to rouse from sleep, revive to life; Gondi_Trtēḍānāto rise, (other dialects)tēd-id.

Word: tirītānā "to revolve, turn round, of bullocks in an oil-mill or threshing; wander, make a detour"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tr caus.tiruhtānāto make to revolve;tirīstānāto make to wander; Gondi_Wtirahtānāto turn (tr.); Gondi_Ph caus.tirahtānā,tirisahtānāto cause to turn over; Gondi_Stirah-/tirh-to make to revolve

Word: tuhkānā "to cough (of cattle in the rainy season)"
uhuttānā "to put on a petticoat (of a woman only)"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Mulōtawife; Gondi_Slōtad(pl.lōtav) female member of a house;lōturmale member of a house; Gondi_Trrōpāwithin; Gondi_Phropā,roppā,roppāṭe,rappoṛinside; Gondi_Wropāinside, within; Gondi_Yropo, Gondi_G, Gondi_Slopo, Gondi_Mulappa, Gondi_Mlopainside
Also Gondi_Trjawā unḍānāto take food (jawāporridge, food);uhtānāto make to drink; Gondi_Wúhtánáto make to drink; Gondi_Mūṇḍhānāto cause to drink; Gondi_Kusp-to give to drink
Also Gondi_W, Gondi_Phuccahtānāto cause to sit; Gondi_Aupis-, Gondi_A (SR)uppūs-, Gondi_Trupsuhtānā, Gondi_Muupih-, Gondi_Maupʔ-, Gondi_Supcah-to make to sit

Word: ursānā "to plant or transplant (trees, rice, chillies, etc.)"

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Auc, Gondi_Chūc, Gondi_Kousul, Gondi_Ko (B)hucculspittle, saliva; Gondi_A, Gondi_Mu, Gondi_Susk-to spit, spit out (pl. action); Gondi_Ma, Gondi_Suskul, Gondi_Muusklespittle

Word: urpānā (Gramm. uṛpānā) "to clean a threshing floor"
Meaning: to clean up, scrape up, collect

Word: wattānā "to be dry, wither (of a tree)"
wāngānā "to trickle (of water, grain, dust, etc.)"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Ma, Gondi_Kovanc-to strain off water from boiled rice
Also Gondi_Trwarhuttānā,warīstānāto frighten;waṛhūcarscarecrow; Gondi_Marey-to be afraid; Gondi_Lrepīhfear; Gondi_A (Su.)verēfear
Notes: The bisyllabic character of the root caused the metathese*veri->*vre->*re-in several dialects.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Ko caus.veṛh-,vehṛ-; Gondi_Trwaṛhuttānāto hang (tr.); Gondi_Muvaṛeman article on which something is hung, stalk of fruit

Word: sōkānā "to apply ointment, hot water, etc. to one's skin"
tiṛil "the large orange-coloured centipede; a caterpillar which crawls swiftly and bites"
